results.adx_keywords: Uvalde, Tex, Shooting (May 24, 2022);School Shootings and Armed Attacks;Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;Ramos, Salvador (d 2022);Mireles, Eva (1978-2022);Robb Elementary School (Uvalde, Tex);Uvalde (Tex)
results.title: Aware of Injuries Inside, Uvalde Police Waited to Confront Gunman
results.abstract: More than a dozen students remained alive for over an hour before officers entered their classrooms. The commander feared a risk to officers’ lives, new documents show.

media.caption: An outdoor hallway at Robb Elementary School. The police response to a mass shooting there is now the subject of overlapping investigations by the Texas state police and the U.S. Justice Department.
media.copyright: Ivan Pierre Aguirre for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Politics and Government;Demonstrations, Protests and Riots;Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Primaries and Caucuses;Republican Party;Michigan
results.title: Ryan Kelley, a candidate for Michigan governor who was at the Capitol on Jan. 6, is arrested by the F.B.I.
results.abstract: Mr. Kelley faces several misdemeanor charges, including disorderly conduct, in connection with the attack on the Capitol.

media.caption: Ryan Kelley is the first person running for election in a major state or federal race to be charged in connection with the attack.
media.copyright: Emily Rose Bennett for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Politics and Government;Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Airlines and Airplanes;Propaganda;Aviation Accidents, Safety and Disasters;United States International Relations;International Relations;Defense and Military Forces;Territorial Disputes;China
results.title: Chinese Pilots Sent a Message. American Allies Said They Went Too Far.
results.abstract: Australia and Canada said Chinese jets harassed their military planes, though Beijing says it was defending its security. A mishap over Pacific waters could have ominous repercussions.

media.caption: A Chinese J-16 fighter jet, in an undated photo released by Taiwan’s defense ministry. Australia said a J-16 harassed one of its surveillance planes over the South China Sea last month.
media.copyright: Taiwan Ministry of Defense, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Customs, Etiquette and Manners;Content Type: Service
results.title: Can I Tell My Parents That Their Estate Plan Hurts My Feelings?
results.abstract: A reader is upset that her brother and each of his children will inherit the same amount as she does.

media.copyright: Miguel Porlan

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus Return to Office;Workplace Environment;Work-Life Balance;Telecommuting;United States
results.title: A Full Return to the Office? Does ‘Never’ Work for You?
results.abstract: Employer plans have played out like a game of chicken. Now workers are rebelling outright, and executives are trying everything to make the office worth it.

media.caption: A full lot at the artificial intelligence company C3 AI, which has required workers to be at the office since last June.
media.copyright: Aaron Wojack for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Presidential Election of 2020;United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J;House of Representatives
results.title: How to Watch the Jan. 6 Committee Hearings
results.abstract: The first of several upcoming hearings by the House committee investigating the attack on the Capitol will be held on Thursday evening.

media.caption: Committee leaders have indicated that the focus on Thursday will be on presenting a complete timeline of the riot, beginning with the 2020 election and extending through the riot itself and its aftermath.
media.copyright: Kenny Holston for The New York Times

results.title: Spelling Bee Forum
results.abstract: Feeling stuck on today’s puzzle? We can help.

results.byline: By Maria Cramer and Jesus Jiménez
results.title: Armed Man Traveled to Justice Kavanaugh’s Home to Kill Him, Officials Say
results.abstract: The man, Nicholas John Roske, 26, said he was upset about the shooting in Uvalde, Texas, and impending decisions on abortion and guns, a federal affidavit says.

media.caption: Justice Brett M. Kavanaugh in 2019. An armed man was arrested near his home in Chevy Chase, Md., early Wednesday.
media.copyright: Doug Mills/The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Presidential Election of 2020;United States Politics and Government;Project Democracy;Kushner, Jared;Trump, Donald J;Trump, Ivanka;House of Representatives
results.title: How Jared Kushner Washed His Hands of Donald Trump Before Jan. 6
results.abstract: Mr. Kushner’s role in the final months of the Trump White House could come into sharp relief once the committee investigating the attack on the Capitol opens hearings.

media.caption: Jared Kushner’s decision to withdraw from the most consequential moment of the Trump presidency left few effective counterweights to plotters looking to subvert the 2020 election.
media.copyright: Erin Schaff/The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Right-Wing Extremism and Alt-Right;Presidential Election of 2020;United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J;Quested, Nick;Proud Boys;House of Representatives
results.title: ‘Trump Was at the Center’: Jan. 6 Hearing Lays Out Case in Vivid Detail
results.abstract: The House panel investigating the attack led its public sessions with video testimony from people close to the former president about his actions before and during the riot.

media.caption: Footage of the attack on the Capitol was shown on a television screen inside the hearing room on Thursday.
media.copyright: Kenny Holston for The New York Times

results.title: Only one House Republican who voted for a Jan. 6 inquiry has lost a primary so far.
results.abstract: Eleven of 14 incumbents have won their primaries, with two contests still to be determined. Primary challenges still await a dozen more.

media.caption: Representative Liz Cheney’s race in Wyoming has drawn national attention, and a Trump-endorsed opponent.

results.title: ‘This Is Uncomfortable’: Saudi Arabia Upends Genteel World of Pro Golf
results.abstract: By promising top players multimillion-dollar paydays, the kingdom moved beyond investing in a sport and made a play to control one. Then the PGA Tour struck back.

media.caption: Phil Mickelson is one of the prize catches for the new LIV Golf Invitational Series. He reportedly is receiving $200 million to take part.
media.copyright: Paul Childs/Action Images Via Reuters

results.title: Starbucks’s C.E.O. Howard Schultz: ‘I don’t know if we can keep our bathrooms open.’
results.abstract: Speaking at The Times’s DealBook D.C. policy forum, Howard Schultz said safety concerns have prompted Starbucks to reconsider its 2018 policy on customer use of restrooms.

media.caption: Howard Schultz, Starbucks’s interim chief executive. He rejoined the company in the role last month.
media.copyright: Amanda Andrade-Rhoades for The New York Times

results.title: How the Texans and a Spa Enabled Deshaun Watson’s Troubling Behavior
results.abstract: Watson met at least 66 women for massages over a 17-month period, far more than previously known. He had help from the Houston Texans, including nondisclosure agreements, in making appointments.

media.copyright: Mel Haasch

results.title: Reporter Felicia Sonmez Is Fired by The Washington Post
results.abstract: Ms. Sonmez, a national political reporter, has been at the center of a debate over The Post’s social media policies.

media.caption: The Washington Post told Felicia Sonmez, a national political reporter, that her “public attempts to question the motives of your co-journalists” undermined its reputation.
media.copyright: Pablo Martinez Monsivais/Associated Press

results.title: As the Great Salt Lake Dries Up, Utah Faces An ‘Environmental Nuclear Bomb’

results.title: A New Study Points to a Surprisingly Simple Way to Ward Off Knee Pain
results.abstract: Encouraging new research suggests walking could help prevent new bouts of knee pain in people with osteoarthritis.

results.title: Five Marines Dead in Military Plane Crash in California
results.abstract: All aboard the plane, an MV-22B Osprey that belonged to the 3rd Marine Aircraft Wing, crashed in a remote area east of San Diego, the U.S. Marine Corps said.

media.caption: A U.S. Marine MV-22B Osprey during an exercise near El Centro, Calif., last year.
media.copyright: Cpl. Andrew Cortez/U.S. Marine Corps
